title: Report: Space Force transitioning to new model for the defense of space
summary: ‘In the coming years, the Space Force will likely take additional steps toward a more distributed and proliferated approach for defense space capabilities’

title: Space Pioneer raises $207 million for reusable rocket
summary: Chinese commercial company Space Pioneer has secured fresh funding for its reusable Tianlong-3 rocket, targeting launch contracts for megaconstellation plans.

title: SpaceX Cheers Successful Starship IFT-4
summary: The fourth test flight of SpaceX’s enormous Starship/Super Heavy rocket appears to be a complete success. The Super Heavy booster made its first soft landing in the water and the […]

title: Starship survives reentry during fourth test flight
summary: SpaceX conducted the fourth test flight of its Starship launch system June 6, with both the Super Heavy booster and Starship upper stage making it back to the surface intact.

title: HPE’s Spaceborne Computer offers template for space-based AI
summary: Recently upgraded and returned to the ISS, Spaceborne-2.5 is ready for new duties.

title: China seeks its own Apollo moment – and more
summary: From expanding the Tiangong space station to a crewed moon landing by 2030, China aims to become the leading human spaceflight power.

title: Remembering the humans in human spaceflight
summary: we must develop innovative approaches to overcome novel challenges and achieve success in long-duration human spaceflight missions.

title: SpaceX’s Starship rocket completes test flight for the first time, successfully splashes down
summary: SpaceX completed a test flight of its Starship rocket for the first time on Thursday, as the company pushed development of the mammoth vehicle past new milestones.

title: Chang’e-6 spacecraft dock in lunar orbit ahead of journey back to Earth
summary: An ascent vehicle docked with the Chang’e-6 service module Thursday, in a critical step towards bringing the first lunar far side samples to Earth.

title: Astroscale shares soar in Tokyo stock market debut
summary: Shares in satellite servicing and debris removal company Astroscale jumped in the first day of trading on the Tokyo Stock Exchange June 5, giving the company a valuation of about $1 billion.
